research.researchHeading: Content Based Video Ranking
research.researchDescription: The proposed system will rank the videos based on the textual content in it. The idea will be to utilize video to speech conversion and then using speech to text conversion technique a .rtf file will be extracted. Further, this file is cleaned to extract the text to be matched with a standard document over a topic. Based on the matching, a document relevance score is obtained for each video. Further, this score is aggregated with other video characteristics like likes v/s views (high weighting factor), length of the video (as penalizing factor), source of the video (having high value for a more authenticated or liked source) to get the final scores for each video. This processing enables us to fetch the most relevant videos for a topic based search especially, educational videos, interviews etc.

research.researchHeading: Smart Monitoring and Control for Electrical Appliances
research.researchDescription:
The project deals with the design and control of the Manipal automation system using raspberry pi as the central device, a web server router and an android application on any smart phone which would act as a user interface. The automated control of appliances through android application will not only help us to keep the track that which appliance is switched off and which is on but one can remotely operate it through it.

Tenure -  December 2016-  October 2017

research.researchHeading: Quality improvement in rolling industry using GrayTagchi DOE method
research.researchDescription:
May 2011 to June 2012, Manufacturing Engg, Industrial Engg.
Green Supply Chain Management (GSCM) is one of the recent innovations for the enhancement of capabilities of Supply Chain Management. In this paper, we aim to study the various activities of the Supply Chain processes of the various Indian manufacturing Industries i.e. both small &large scale industries and finds how much eco-friendly they are (i.e. how much % of the green factor are involved in their supply chain activities from the procurement of the raw material to the transportation of the final product to consumer) for the purpose of metering the performance of the manufacturing sectors has been studied. The major eight activities of the supply chain; namely Green Procurement, Green Manufacturing, Green Warehousing, Green Distribution, Green Packaging, Green Transportation, Life Cycle Assessment, Eco-design are being covered throughout the research. From these above process activities we measured the green practise and performance of green supply chain management with the various case studies. These are helps to various crucial performance indicators & their sub-indicator’s. The research outcome based on the case study in this paper we identifies the important results that are causes impact on the environment by supply chain of manufacturing sectors. In this paper, we discussed how the various supply chain factors affecting environment. By the help of literature review we identify various indicators &sub- Indicators in order to find out the sustainability performance of various manufacturing.

research.researchHeading: Assessment and design for sustainable green supply chain management
research.researchDescription:
May 2011 to Dec 2011, Quality Control in Service Industries, Environmental Management System,This paper investigation proved that it is possible to improve both product quality and process performance in the rolling plant through the parameters design approach. There Gray Taguchi method is used to find the optimal heat treatment parameters for multi quality performance. Experimentation effort indicates that the existing heat treatment process produces steel strip with a uniformity that is very near the optimum achievable.
The philosophy and methodology of Gray Taguchi’s parameter design method is presented in term of robust process design application. Taguchi’s contribution to the field of quality engineering, including the orthogonal array, signal-to-noise ratio, and analysis of variance are employed with Gary relational analysis to study the multi quality performance characteristics in heat treatment process of SAE 1080 carbon steel strips. Three heat treatment process parameter namely, flame/soaking temperatures range in zone 1-2-3-4, strip speed, tempering temperature are optimised with consideration of hardness & tensile strength. The effects of control factor are studied using analysis of means and signal-to-noise ratio. 
Through optimisation of heat treatment process parameters, it was possible to obtain desired hardness & tensile strength. Consequently, plant down time and production scrap was considerably reduced.

research.researchHeading: Adaptive Signal Processing for Beam-Forming RADAR
research.researchDescription: To achieve ‘Vision Zero Collision’ objective in smart vehicle, radar based ADAS (Automatic Driving Assistant System) are being developed worldwide. Motivated by the above requirement toward public safety driving, this paper aims at modeling such radar for vehicular friendship. This paper is now catering for development and modeling of radar having two ADAS modes of operation namely i) ADAS1 with mode 1 having capability of collision avoidance by detecting the multiple target present on the road with the help of switched transmit beam which is MVDR (Minimum Variance Distortionless Response) technique. ii) ADAS2 with mode 2 having capability of collision avoidance and also helps driver to track the other vehicle with the help of PCM (Phase-Comparison Monopulse).  An adaptive beam forming MIMO radar ADAS1 has been modeled and one on-road vehicle has been detected. ADAS 2 will be based on tracking the passing vehicle and is also modeled which has the capability to measure the bearing angle of the passing vehicles. Tracking of one vehicle to another is very complex due to the environment; this tracking can be done with the help of Mono-pulse antenna pattern and utilizing this Monopulse sum & deference channel data, the angle error has been estimated. RLS is used for angle error correction for beam to be steered to that particular vehicle. For today’s vehicular driver assistance, this digital beam forming based adaptive tracking system is highly efficient and can be utilized for commercial use.

research.researchHeading: Planar Antennas for sensing system in Bio-medical Applications
research.researchDescription: Increasing demand in wireless communication technology having greater spectral efficiency, high data rate and fading mitigation, terahertz frequency (0.1–10 THz) are being explored by the researchers in the past few years, due to the scarcity of available spectrum for handling, the high data rates in wireless communication. This spectrum is having several unique features like requirement of low power, up to 10 Gbps data rate, probability of low interference etc. for applications like screening of biohazards and explosives, to find images of hidden objects, sensing etc., also providing wide bandwidth. From the available literature numerous antenna structures like surface integrated waveguide, log-periodic, horn antenna, microstrip etc. are investigated for use in terahertz band in compact wireless technology. All these structures have a common feature of three-dimensional structure due to which they could not be integrated with compact structure. Microstrip antenna can be easily integrable with compact device because of reduced size up to sub-millimetre and with minimum cost. A very high path loss is enforced at this frequency, leads to short communication distance which is the main concern at THz (Terahertz).
